page.title: 09Recreation in Lorton
page.content: Considering the remote area there is a vast range of recreational pursuits, and as expected most activities take place out of doors. Ever popular with many are walking and gardening. Fishing and canoeing take place on the River Cocker. Animals feature regularly and activities include horse riding, fox hunting, the dog show, bee-keeping, and ornithology. Hound trailing, an activity unique to Cumbria takes place and is followed by many, particularly farmers. The Tennis Club attracts the occasional player as well as 73 members who have entered teams in the West Cumb. league. Airborne activities include model radio controlled aeroplanes, and one resident of our block pilots a microlight. Competitive clay pigeon matches often take place. Indoor hobbies range from glass engraving to
